New Records: Ravindra and Conway's unbeaten 177-run partnership, highest partnership for two New Zealand batters in a Cricket World Cup encounter, surpassing the 168-run stand between Chris Harris and Lee Germon from 1996
Key Match Events: Rachin Ravindra announced himself with a Player of the Match-winning ton
Jos Buttler scored 43 before being caught behind
Joe Root and Liam Livingstone tried to go for their runs but fell to Boult and Phillips respectively
Pre-Game Insights: Tom Latham called it right at the toss and decided to field
England had concerns of their own, as star all-rounder Ben Stokes was out of the opening encounter
The World Cup opener will be a rematch between the two finalists from the 2019 Cricket World Cup
Post-Match Reflections: No specific post-match reflections provided in the article
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jonny Bairstow began England's title defence in style, hitting a six off the very second ball of the game
Harry Brook hit 4, 4, 6 off the last three deliveries in Rachin Ravindra's first over but gifted a catch in the deep midwicket region
Others: England managed to reach 282 at the back of an unbeaten 30-run 10th wicket partnership between Adil Rashid and Mark Wood
This was the first-ever occasion that all the eleven batters in a side had reached double figures
